channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report I-2024020007
item.description:
Report I-2024020007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: DULLES
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: *During boarding process, passenger had a backpack carry-on that began smoking. *The passenger emptied the inflamed contents onto seat 58G. * The flight attendant used the water from liter and a half bottle to put out the flame. *Then placed the bag in a TCB and placed in the aft lav until the Fire Department arrived. *The fire department collected Thermal Bag with the backpack *The items inside the bag were a vape pen and lithium batteries that were disconnected *No passenger or crew injury. Passenger Information: [PII REDACTED - GEM]

item.title: Report X-2024020436
item.description:
Report X-2024020436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IN THE UNLOAD, THE HAZMAT WAS UNLOADED FROM THE TRAILER AND SLAMMED INTO THE ROLLERS CAUSING ONE OF THE ECOLAB BOTTLES TO UNSCREW AND SPILL. DescribePack: DURING THE INSPECTION, ONE OF THE BOTTLE CAPS WERE LOOSE DUE TO IMPROPER HANDLING CAUSING THE BOX TO RIP OPEN. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGE HAZMAT WAS PLACED IN A SAFETY CONTAINER TO PREVENT OTHER PACKAGES FROM GETTING WET.

item.title: Report X-2024020376
item.description:
Report X-2024020376

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: ASHLAND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND DURING THE PRELOAD SORT LEAKING AND AFTER ASSESSING THE INSIDE IT WAS FOUND THAT 2 OF THE 4 BOTLES CLOSURE WAS LOOSE AND MAJORITY OF THE CONTENTS HAD LEAKED. DescribePack: CLOSURE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE MOVED TO THE HAZXMAT CAGE
